data.title: University Career Center
data.text:
Hello! I am a member of the employer relations team at the UCC and focus on engaging with employers from a variety of industries who are looking to connect with U-M students. I love to interact with students to learn more about their interests and career aspirations in order to better connect them with potential employers. I work directly with undergraduate and recently graduated students in both 1 on 1 and group settings to help guide them on their career journey.

As a Ph.D. Career Coach, I specialize in empowering Ph.D. students across diverse fields to successfully transition into non-faculty careers. I live for the “Aha” moment when a student crafts the perfect resume bullet point, discovers a new opportunity, or feels empowered. I’m excited to support you on every step of the journey, from brainstorming job options to acing interviews and negotiating job offers.

Greetings! As an Assistant Director, I support the career development of U-M's Ph.D. students through 1:1 career counseling, program development and delivery, and service as liaison to Rackham Graduate School. Additionally, I consult and collaborate with U-M faculty in support of graduate student career development. I’ve been engaged in gender and diversity issues throughout my career, and enjoy working with graduate students at all stages of their career and educational journeys.

As an Assistant Director, I am passionate about connecting with students, whether they're undergrads just starting their journey or graduate students honing their career paths. My role is all about helping students figure out how to express their skills, values, and passions when it comes to their future careers. I love spending my time coaching students one-on-one, as well as facilitating workshops, programs, and events. An energizer of mine is supporting students to develop and grow as future trailblazers.

Welcome! I serve as the Assistant Director of Employer Relations & Strategic Initiatives within the University Career Center. In this role, I oversee our employer engagement strategy and our employer relations team. I also have the privilege of meeting with students to discuss their career exploration and development.

As the Social Media & Community Engagement Strategist, I manage the University Career Center’s online presence ⏤ including the UCC’s website/online tools, email campaigns, and social media accounts. I’m excited about the opportunity to connect with you and other students to learn more about how the UCC can assist you in reaching your goals.

Aloha everyone; I am one of the UCC's Career Coaches. I’m energized when I help students realize their personal strengths and the confidence they need to succeed. I provide personalized guidance, resume and cover letter reviews, job search and gap year planning, networking, Handshake overview, interviewing tips, behavioral mock interviews, and medical school mock interviews. I also lead the Clothes Closet and serve as the UCC liaison to Asian American and Pacific Islanders (AAPI) and Native American Student Association (NASA).

As the Director of the University Career Center, I am deeply passionate about empowering students through higher education and career development support. I have had the privilege of working with institutions such as the University of California system and the University of Michigan's Alumni Association, where I served the 650,000-strong alumni community. This experience has allowed me to gain valuable insights into the diverse needs and aspirations of students and alumni alike. I earned a master's degree in higher education from the School of Education in 2010.

As the Senior Associate Director, I spend my time facilitating for today and planning for tomorrow. I believe in the power of possibilities, unfettered thinking, and an open mind. It is an absolute privilege to work with the University Career Center’s talented staff and I encourage you to put their expertise to work for you. But don't stop there! I have worked with students, employers, alumni/ae, and University colleagues! They are all eager to help as you explore, decide, and launch your career. Take advantage of all that the U (and beyond) has to offer!

Hello there! I’m an Assistant Director here at the University Career Center (UCC) where I lead out our career coaching team. We’re here to support you in your career journey and can’t wait to work with you!

I’m all about helping students transition with confidence to their next steps after Michigan. I work with both undergraduate and masters students on exploring different career options, job/internship search strategies, and preparing for graduate school.

Hi! I'm Angelicia, the Industry to Campus Connector on the Employer Relations team. I'm here to assist with employer partnership development, recruiting strategies, and utilizing Handshake for your recruitment needs at the University of Michigan. Whether you're a seasoned recruiter or just getting started, I've got you covered.

Outside of the University Career Center, you can find me engaged in service projects with my sorority, exploring independent restaurants for great food, and thoroughly dissecting the latest movie trailers.

I'm Elizabeth, and I serve on our employer relations team, where I build and maintain relationships with top employers across various industries who are interested in recruiting UM students. I enjoy learning more about the qualities and skills employers are seeking in our students.

Hi everyone!

As the Experiential Learning Coordinator at the University Career Center, I collaborate with employer partners to create immersive experiences for the University of Michigan students through Immersions and Employer Challenges. My goal is to create educational opportunities that foster personal growth and enable individuals to flourish.

Hello. As Office Manager of the University Career Center my focus is geared toward the business operations of the center. I support the department in the areas of budget/finance, human resources, procurement, facilities and organizational compliance.

On a personal note, I enjoy spending time with my wife and two children, cooking, and reading most things non-fiction.

I am a program coordinator as well as a supervisor of the Public Service Intern Program at UCC. I specialize in supporting students who are seeking out professional opportunities in government and public service, and I also manage the Government Career Track. If you are passionate about wanting to work for the federal or state government, please come talk to me!

Hi, my name is Nick, and I am the Pre-Professional Services Coordinator at the UCC. I support U-M Pre-Health and Pre-Law students as they navigate planning their careers, including exploring career options, pursuing volunteer and other experiences outside of the classroom, and understanding the various considerations necessary for applying to programs. Aside from working 1 on 1 with U-M students, I manage the UCC’s Health and Law career tracks, as well as our Med App and Gearing Up to Apply (GUTA) canvas sites.

Hello! I serve as a Career Services Connector meaning that I work in delivering customer service and driving student development within our vibrant University Career Center. You’ll often find me at the front desk where I am the front-line contact for students, alumni, and university staff, providing guidance, information, and support through various channels, including our state-of-the-art Handshake platform. Being an Alum from the University of Michigan, I am passionate about working with students to support them in their endeavors of professional success.

Hello there! I'm Rachel Zhang, Career Coordinator for international students. I am passionate about supporting you, whether your next journey leads you to a job, graduate school, or any other path you decide to pursue. As a proud member of the Direct Service Team, I'm on a mission to link you up with the fantastic tools and resources that can supercharge your career development. You can count on me for personalized 1:1 advising and exciting programming. Together, we'll navigate the pathways to your dreams and aspirations, making sure you have all the support you need.
